result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Stearns Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 4 days sentence credit in the amount of $75.00 per day for a total of $300, in lieu of payment for the fine. Balance of fine and costs to be paid in 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J Stearns Jr

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 1:31 p.m.
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Patrick J Stearns Jr in court.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant make statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Fine:  $505.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Defendant has 4-days credit time (Court converts 1 day to $75.00 = $300.00 to be applied to the fine/surcharge*
Balance of $405.00 to be paid in 90-days
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

Court does not set bail.
Court order the defendant to be held in the Waukesha County Jail until Wednesday - September 14, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.
